Become part of the Ballad Health story.

Together, we are transforming our region. We’re making communities healthier. We’re expanding access to critical services in rural areas. We’re investing in health research and medical education.

And we need you!

Ballad Health is seeking compassionate individuals who are excited about making a difference and caring for those in need.

Search our job listings to find the right fit for your unique skills and experience.

Looking for physician opportunities?

Are you searching for a more collaborative environment? A challenging leadership opportunity? Access to advanced technologies? More flexibility for balancing work, play and family life?

Learn more about Ballad Health’s physician career opportunities.

Patient access, medical billing and coding opportunities

For opportunities in our revenue cycle – such as patient access, medical billing and coding, as well as accounts receivable and scheduling – please visit Ensemble Health Partners.

Food, nutrition and housekeeping opportunities

For job opportunities in our food and nutrition and housekeeping departments, please visit Compass One.

Have a heart for volunteering?

There’s a place for you!

Maybe you’d like to help lift up patients and their families by sharing your art, music or pet therapy dog. Or, perhaps working in a gift shop or greeting hospital visitors is more your thing.

From volunteer chaplains to students who want to offer their time and hearts to help others, we have a place for you at Ballad Health. Learn more about volunteering at Ballad Health.

Students – come learn with us!

At Ballad Health we have an important responsibility to share our knowledge and experience so others will be equipped to provide top-notch health care wherever they go.

We also realize that helping students is another way to help us find great team members in the future. That’s why we offer everything from job shadowing opportunities to nurse internships to medical student residencies. Our training and certification courses are available for both team members and community health workers, and we also offer a FREE certified nurse assistant course – students can apply, take the course and be ready to work in health care.

Call us at (423) 431‑HR4U (431‑4748) to learn more about our student programs.
